info.name: Glossopharyngeal nerve
info.description: The ninth or glossopharyngeal cranial nerve has both sensory and motor components which enter/exit the brain stem along the lateral aspect of the medulla dorsal to the olive. The sensory component includes tactile sensation and taste from the posterior 1/3rd of the tongue as well as input from the carotid body/sinus, middle and external ear; the motor component innervates the stylopharyngeus muscle (3rd pharyngeal arch origin) and provides the parasympathetic preganglionic fibers that control secretion of the parotid gland.
